intro: Wimmeria caudata, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is commonly found in wetlands and along stream banks. Wimmeria caudata is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
